conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from each entry point (A, B, C, and D) through the baffles.
Identify the entry points: A is Yellow, B is Green, C is Light Blue, D is Dark Blue.
From A (Yellow): The liquid flows down and encounters the first baffle (light blue).
From A (Yellow): It then moves horizontally to the right and hits the second baffle (orange).
From A (Yellow): The liquid continues downward and hits the third baffle (gray).
From A (Yellow): It moves left and hits the fourth baffle (red).
From A (Yellow): Finally, it flows down into container E.
From B (Green): The liquid flows down and hits the first baffle (orange).
From B (Green): It moves left and hits the second baffle (light blue).
From B (Green): The liquid continues downward and hits the third baffle (gray).
From B (Green): It moves right and hits the fourth baffle (red).
From B (Green): Finally, it flows down into container F.
From C (Light Blue): The liquid flows down and hits the first baffle (light blue).
From C (Light Blue): It moves right and hits the second baffle (orange).
From C (Light Blue): The liquid continues downward and hits the third baffle (gray).
From C (Light Blue): It moves left and hits the fourth baffle (red).
From C (Light Blue): Finally, it flows down into container F.
From D (Dark Blue): The liquid flows down and hits the first baffle (blue).
From D (Dark Blue): It moves left and hits the second baffle (orange).
From D (Dark Blue): The liquid continues downward and hits the third baffle (gray).
From D (Dark Blue): It moves right and hits the fourth baffle (red).
From D (Dark Blue): Finally, it flows down into container G.
